pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw: [This post](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/19917#note_647975) actually suggests to add `cxx_std_11` to public `target_compile_features` instead of passing the compiler flag. [With CMake 3.15\+](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge_requests/3023), it will result in adding no flags when using a C\+\+11-compatible compiler. But CMake 3.14- \(e.g. 3.10 used in Bionic\) will still pass the `-std=c++1` flag :disappointed:
content.html: This post actually suggests to add cxx_std_11 to public target_compile_features instead of passing the compiler flag. With CMake 3.15+, it will result in adding no flags when using a C++11-compatible compiler. But CMake 3.14- (e.g. 3.10 used in Bionic) will still pass the -std=c++1 flag
